intro: Obione chapinii, commonly known as the Chapin's obione, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Obione chapinii is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphology.
